Under the Freedom of Information Act please see the following request:
Request details:
1. Please provide the strategic plans on how the transformation fund for
family hubs will be spent.
2. Has a digital solution already been procured? If so, who is the
providing the platform?
3. Does the family hub system have integration with the council’s current
education, youth justice, or social care systems?
4. Who is the best person to contact around this area?
Yours faithfully,
Luke Rigby

Dear Luke Rigby,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Family Hubs
Strategy which we received on 21/12/2023.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
1. Please provide the strategic plans on how the transformation fund for
family hubs will be spent.
The infusion of transformation funding has been used in several areas:
• Staff Capacity: it has boosted our ability to enhance staff capacity
for system development within the program model framework, ensuring
that we not only meet broader service expectations but also align with
the program's framework requirements.
• Brand identity: We have successfully launched from Children Centres to
Family Hubs and maintained a robust communication strategy with both
service users and providers. This strategic communication approach is
deeply embedded within our broader Early Help strategy.
• Virtual offer: enhancing the virtual offerings of key Start for Life
services to meet and exceed expectations, ensuring accessibility for
families. Concurrently, we are committed to nurturing the growth of a
Family Hub Network.
• Oral Health: Recognising the pressing need, we have also allocated
resources towards improving Oral Health outcomes. Statistics reveal a
higher prevalence and severity of tooth decay among 5-year-olds
compared to regional and national averages. In the 20% most deprived
areas of our city, 60% of children are affected (Source: PHE, 2019,
Child and Maternal Health - Oral health).
• Nutrition & Weight Management support: This will enable the creation
of a dedicated position to work closely with the Health Visiting
Service, providing tailored assistance to families with children
identified as at-risk of obesity during the 2-year health visitor
assessment, on a one-to-one basis.
• Outdoor Play: Lastly, we are excited to unveil plans for the
development of outdoor play facilities at select Family Hubs, catering
to children of all age groups. Concurrently, investment in staff
training will empower them to become qualified instructors, capable of
extending their expertise to numerous other organizations interested
in outdoor play. This endeavour aims to expand our offerings for older
children, foster deeper connections with youth and SEND services, and
further promote integration with service providers in the VCF sector.
2. Has a digital solution already been procured? If so, who is the
providing the platform?
Sheffield City Council has acquired a digital solution from PPL to
facilitate the delivery of the Sheffield Directory. This digital platform
is currently in use to fulfil the requirements of both the Family Hubs and
the Start for Life Programme.
3. Does the family hub system have integration with the council’s current
education, youth justice, or social care systems?
Yes
4. Who is the best person to contact around this area?
Lead for Family Hub & start for Life programme in Sheffield is – Lorraine
Wood.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
